items.title: Trump claims he and Xi Jinping approved a deal for TikTok's US operations; Chinese media's readout only says that China respects the wishes of businesses (Ben Berkowitz/Axios)
items.summary:
Ben Berkowitz / Axios:
Trump claims he and Xi Jinping approved a deal for TikTok's US operations; Chinese media's readout only says that China respects the wishes of businesses  —  President Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping spoke about a TikTok deal Friday, but details on the social media platform's U.S. future remain unclear.

items.title: More than 70 killed in attack by Sudan paramilitary in al-Fashir, Sovereignty Council says
items.summary: (Reuters) - More than 70 people were killed when Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces carried out a drone strike on a mosque in al-Fashir, the capital of North Darfur state, during prayers, the country's Sovereignty Council said on Friday. Read full story

items.title: US House passes bipartisan resolution honoring Charlie Kirk

items.title: Meta files an application for authorization "to sell energy, capacity, and certain ancillary services" in the US amid rising energy demand for AI datacenters (Bloomberg)
items.summary:
Bloomberg:
Meta files an application for authorization “to sell energy, capacity, and certain ancillary services” in the US amid rising energy demand for AI datacenters  —  Meta Platforms Inc. is pushing to break into the wholesale power-trading business so it can better manage the massive electricity needs of its data centers.

items.title: Ride into autumn with up to 20% discounts on Navee’s electric scooters + bonus and bundle savings – all starting from $360
items.summary:
Navee has launched its Autumn Sale that is taking up to 20% off a lineup of electric scooters, complete with bonus savings (using the code AFF50), bundle discounts, and more. Among the lineup, a great model for college students needing a reliable way around campus/town is the GT3 Max Smart Electric Scooter for $649.99 shipped with a FREE phone mount, after using the sitewide code AFF50 for an additional $50 off. It’s down from its usual $730 MSRP for the time being, which is where it’s currently priced at Amazon. This is the latest model under the brand’s flag, coming behind the flagship ST3 Pro model, which hit the market back in July and has dropped as low as $693 at Amazon, with the brand’s direct sales so far having seen it go to $620 and a one-time $561 low during August’s Back to School Sale. You’re looking at the third-lowest price tracked while the sale continues, giving you $80 off the going rate and giving your commute a much smarter solution.

more…

This bundle typically goes $60 and is rarely discounted, but you can now score it with a 39% markdown. That’s $20 off, making it the lowest price we’ve seen. For context, the controller alone is currently $50, and historically, the Pro 2 has never dipped below $36 on its own. It’s a great time to cash in if you were eying one of these, so grab it before it jumps back up in price.

items.summary:
We are now tracking a deal at Amazon that drops Logitech’s G PRO X SUPERLIGHT 2 DEX wireless gaming mouse down to $129.99 shipped. This particular mouse hit the scene around the same time last year carrying a $160 price tag, but it’s been sitting at the $180 mark since it jumped up in price earlier this year. Today’s deal delivers a 28% discount, shaving $50 off its usual going rate to mark the lowest price we have tracked for this model. While the standard SUPERLIGHT 2 has dipped lower before, the DEX model has never hit this price point. You can get it in black, white, and magenta, and they’re all down to the $130 mark today.

items.title: Grab Hades on Switch for just $6 ahead of the Hades II Switch 2 launch next week (75% off), more
items.summary:
During last week’s massive Nintendo Direct, we got the official release date for Metroid Prime 4, loads of exciting announcements for Mario’s 40th anniversary including the new Mario Galaxy package, Virtual Boy for Nintendo Classics, and finally the release date for the highly-anticipated new Hades II on Nintendo Switch 2. If you’re waiting to jump into this one on Switch 2 when it releases starting next week, the original Hades game is a great way to tide you over and you can now score it down at just $6.24 on the eShop, down from the regular $25. Hades II takes place some time after the events of the first game and in the same universe – jumping into the first game makes for a great primer ahead of the sequel’s release. 

Nintendo Switch 2 now up for purchase at Amazon with no invitation needed…have any store credit to use?

While these consoles have been up for grabs at retail online and in-store for some time now, Amazon’s invitation phase is over – if you have some Amazon gift cards and store credit in the holster, this might be your first chance to score a deal on the new Nintendo console. 

more…
